question: what is the main advantage of sprites on the commodore 64
answer: the ease with which they could be moved around the screen

question: what is the purpose of the sprite position registers
answer: to hold the current position of the top left hand corner dot of the sprite on the 320 by 200 dots high resolution screen

question: what chip is responsible for redrawing the display
what happens when you POKE new values into one of the sprite position registers
answer: the VIC chip will move the sprite from its old position to the new one

question: in what range are the x coordinates numbered on the high resolution screen
in what range are the y coordinates numbered on the high resolution screen
what is the problem with using large values of x
answer: the x sprite position registers can only hold numbers in the range to 255

question: what is the purpose of the most significant bit x register
answer: to provide each of the x sprite position registers with an extra high bit, making them 9 bits wide

question: what is the address of the most significant bit x register
what do you need to do if the x coordinate is larger than 255
answer: set the appropriate extra bit, subtract 256 from the x coordinate, and store the remainder in the appropriate sprite position x register

question: what do you need to do if the x coordinate is smaller than 255
answer: reset the appropriate extra bit and store the whole x coordinate in the appropriate sprite position x register

question: what is the purpose of the basic subroutine provided
answer: to set up the sprite position registers correctly, regardless of the size of the x coordinate

question: what variables need to be set before calling the basic subroutine
answer: the sprite number in the SN variable, and the x,y coordinate in the X and Y variables
